Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, just need better service.”
Reviews.Author: AusverGeorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and chose it both because of the location and the not so expensive price for Rome (61 euros). Location is really good, just 3 minutes walking from Termini Central Station. But receptrion staff was not quite friendly. They were politeenough but the feeling is strictly bussiness like, not what you expect at a hotel though. The room was on the ground floor and I had some reservations about noise and safety, but did not have a problem at all. It was comfortable, noticeably renovated recently, particularly the bathroom, that worked perfectly. Wi-fi was fast and good. Breakfast just bread and again, the awkward feeling that you're just another business for hotel and not a guest. But I had a good sleep there and I may stay again if there's the need to.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camila H
Reviews.Content: We got a private room, really clean and confortable with good location for who gets metro. Breakfast was ok. We paid the price of a hostel with the commodities of a hotel, so it was really worth it. The biggest problem was...Rome. The city has great monuments, but that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vishal H
Reviews.Content: A great little budget hotel, nicely located near the Termini station. Room and bathroom are small, but very clean. The people at the reception are friendly and helpful. Free wifi is a plus and breakfast is simple, but good enough to start the day. For the price it is an excellent hotel if you'll be out, exploring the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with no pretention”
Reviews.Author: JMZB5F1
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel is not on the street iself , it is behind the first row of buldings in an internal yard. Hotel is situated close to Termini Station , but just far enough to be out of the station noise and crowd. We got room number 2 - first floor - no elevator , around 20 stairs to climb. Rooms are clean, bathroom is correct - TV is a little bit small , but you don't go to Rome to stay in your room watching TV ^^. Breakfast is simple : a caraf of fruit juice - a cornetto - a panino - 1 biscotte - botter and marmelade at choice - cereals - yoghourt - some cheese Just enough to start the day The breakfast takes place in the reception or you can have in your room The reception is small - only 3 little tables. Good quality/price : cheap hotel Only default in my opinion : too close to Termini to enjoy the night living in the center of Rome...

Reviews.Title: “hotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Seancoo
Reviews.Content: Don,t go here expecting 4star accommodation, but having said that the staff were excellent the rooms were clean and you are close to all the amenities ie train station tour buses and you can walk to most of the main attractions of Rome. for a short stay in Rome I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Sol_Dona
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, super clean rooms. Friendly staff. Close to Roma termini wich makes it very convenient. Great value for Rome-august. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No-frills, clean, but be warned: they lie about their credit card machine.”
Reviews.Author: tigiovanni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my needs: a no-frills overnighter close to the Termini station in order to catch the train for a *very* early flight out of the Rome Fiumicino Airport. The room was clean and moderately spacious; the water pressure was excellent; I felt that my belongings were secure for the day while I meandered around the city for a few hours. However, I would not recommend this hotel for a longer stay in Rome. Being so close to the Termini means it's loud at night - even with the courtyard that did an excellent job of blocking out much of the noise. The streets around the Termini are crowded, noisy, packed with vendors and other characters who want to part you from your money - both legally and otherwise. Even just a few blocks away makes a huge difference. I was informed upon check-in that I needed to pay in cash, even though I had confirmed my reservation online with a credit card. The desk clerk said that the credit card machine was broken; when I told them that they had my credit card information on file and could just charge me once their machine was working again, I was told "No, this is not possible." I had time to go to an ATM machine, but it was an inconvenience I would have rather forgone. Other than that, the service was fine. Romantic getaway? Not even close. But serviceable, for sure. ***NOTE: after reading other reviews on TripAdvisor and Venere.com, I discovered that they've had a "broken credit card machine" since at least 2007. I've changed my mind and would not recommend this hotel to anyone, even someone just staying overnight, based upon this piece of evidence. Hotel Chicago: either start accepting credit cards, or stop accepting online reservations. Misrepresentation through lying is both unethical and distasteful. You won't see my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: vansk
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and well furnished. Staff friendly. Very convenient location, though not nice. Only problem, shortage of warm water.

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Good Location”
Reviews.Author: canadiansig
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station. and cheap. Beware AC is NOT included and costs $10 EURO extra per night. Hard mattress. Staff was friendly however, I wouldn't rely on them for a wakeup call because they sleep in a cot in the main room, therefore bring a cell phone or alarm!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel avoids Credit Cards - Why?”
Reviews.Author: ruyvalka
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at Hotel Chicago, Rome, please try any other hotel. We had just one day to stay in Rome and wanted to make it the most productive. Though we did not expect any luxury for the price, several things are unacceptable at any price. Our Internet reservation was for two double-bed rooms – upon arrival both had a single matrimonial bed. That was solved quite quickly, and the rooms were surprisingly clean. I asked to be woken up at seven (a service provided according to the room menu): On the first morning they simply forgot to ring, we woke up at nine to the shouting of some other angry hotel guest, almost lost the chance to check out the pathetic “continental breakfast”, served at the reception (with room for only six people at a time, no plates, and a limited number of mugs – ask for another coffee before you finish the first one and see for yourself!). After breakfast the attendant informed us that we “should have been informed the previous night” that the creditcard machine was broken – and we would have to pay cash (Checking the site http://www.trav.com/wri-7031/HotelChicagoRoma/Reviews you can see this problem is chronical, at least since april 2007, so there seems to be no interest in solving it – WHY?). I repeated the request to be woken up at seven the following morning, and this time they rang at 6AM! This was my first time in Italian Hotels, so I sincerely hope that not all are like this.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Forehand
Reviews.Content: This is a small rather spartan budget hotel. It is well located near the termini train station with easy access to Rome's sights. Our room was clean and cheerfully decorated. The bathroom was adequate. The two twin beds were the narrowest -- and hardest -- I've ever slept on. I imagine this is what you get in jail. The first time I rolled over, I landed on the floor with a thud. That's how narrow it was. The hotel doesn't really have a lobby. You leave the "office," where the front desk is located, go outside and enter the hotel itself via another door. There's no elevator. There are several rooms located in a pod. To gain access, you have to be buzzed in by the front desk. The entrance is in a small courtyard with apartments and businesses on the opposite side. This isn't so great if one of your neighbors decides to play loud music or have a loud conversation into the wee hours of the morning. That happened a couple of nights. The breakfast isn't worth the trouble. The guy at the front desk demanded payment in cash. He claimed the credit card machine was out of order. At first, I refused, but finally acquiesced. The hotel is OK for what it is, and given the weak dollar, is bareable. But I was glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Hotel Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pack_y0ur_bags
Reviews.Content: I REALLY enjoyed our stay at the Chicago Hotel. I was newly redecorated and had georgous rooms, very clean and even beautifully decorated. For the price, I was surprised. The TV, AC, bidet, worked great. The breakfast was really good, the staff really helpful. We only stayed for one night and on the first floor, as my Mom is disabled, but I can't say what up higher would have been like. I don't think there was an elevator, but the guy at the desk happily carried the bags up anyway. It was the best deal for the price. Gorgeous hotel, and I would suggest it to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Chicago
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gioberti 63, 00185 Rome, Italy
